Description: Body fragment of a relatively small Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel; inside reserved; outside, female to right in a peplos and patterned mantle; perhaps the extended right hand of a male at the right edge of her cloak; added red on the peplos, and for the centre of the rosettes on the mantle; added white dots for petals of the rosettes on the mantle. A repair hole on the left of the fragment.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 94 no. 326 pl. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1994)
